description:
This is the third game in the row of Philips' titles set in Zelda universe. In this game, you play the princess Zelda herself. The evil Gannon has captured and imprisoned the brave hero Link. In order to save him, Zelda has to venture into Tolemac, an uncharted southeastern region of the land of Hyrule, and to collect seven celestial signs, which is the only way to defeat Gannon.

Unlike the two previous Zelda games for CD-i (which were platformers), Zelda's Adventure returns to the traditional top-down view of the series. You navigate Zelda over the world map, visiting towns, talking to townspeople for clues, and descending into dangerous dungeons. You can equip swords, shields, and various kinds of gear. The combat is entirely action-based.
title: Zelda's Adventure

description:
Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon is one of the three Zelda-based games developed by Philips exclusively for the CD-i platform. In the game you control princess Zelda. Her father, the king, went to the land of Gamelon to help Duke Onkled in his battle against the evil Ganon. A month has passed, but there is no news from the king. The brave hero Link decides to find him but then disappears. The young princess travels to Gamelon by herself to find and to free both her father and Link...

Unlike classic Zelda games, Wand of Gamelon is viewed from a side-scrolling perspective. In the beginning you are given a map with several accessible locations. Once you choose a location, you enter a side-view level, where you must fight enemies in real-time combat, as well as meet people who will send you on quests. At any time there are several locations accessible, and many quests can be completed in a non-linear fashion.

sample_screenshots.caption: Aru Ainu level, being attacked  by boars

title: Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon

description: Your mission is to destroy 6 enormous battle cruisers to save the planet. You have 15 days to destroy the ships before they reach your planet. If they do, the consequences will be disastrous. Your prototype ship has been developed and its name is "Steel Machine". You will have to find a way to destroy the main reactors of each battle cruiser, by destroying the main reactor the ship will destabilise causing the cruiser to blow up. The cruisers have lots of enemy defences to be destroyed. The game is a horizontal shoot'em-up based on the old Commodore 64 game Uridium by Andrew Braybrook. It is one of the first CDi game titles which fully uses the hardware. Controlling the Steel Machine is quite simple.
title: Steel Machine

alternate_titles.title: Link: De Gezichten van het Kwaad
Link: The Faces of Evil - A New Interactive Animated Adventure

description: This is one of three Zelda-based games released for the CD-i. Ganon and his cronies have seized the island of Koridai and kidnapped Princess Zelda. Link must fight through Ganon's minions to defeat the Faces of Evil, one at a time. He must also destroy Ganon, free Zelda, and bring peace back to Koridai. This is a side-scrolling platform game with animated cut scenes like Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon.

sample_screenshots.caption: The inside of an igloo in Nortinka

title: Link: The Faces of Evil

description:
This is a puzzle game based on the Nintendo character Mario. The Princess has invited Mario and Luigi to a picnic in the Mushroom Kingdom. But when the Mario Brothers arrive, they learn that King Bowser Koopa is making over the kingdom into his personal resort and the princess has been kidnapped, again.

Mario and Luigi must stop him and rescue the princess by closing doors in the hotels.

Most hotel stages have 10 levels, other stages have less, others more. You close doors by pressing button 2. Enemies will come through some doors and will try to open doors to prevent you from succeeding. You can jump on some enemies by pressing button 1.

Behind some doors, you will find a mushroom that will allow you to take a hit without dying. If you already got a mushroom, you will find a fire flower that will allow you to shoot fireballs by pressing buttons 1 & 2 simultaneously. This will take out some enemies easier and other enemies can only be defeated with the fireball.

When you reach the top level of your current hotel, you will need to close the doors here while avoiding one of the Koopalings. Once you succeed, there will be an animated FMV cutscene then it is off to the next hotel (stage).

All the stages are plays on real hotels, like Morton's WoodDoor-Hysteria Hotel, Roy's HardBrick Hotel, Lemmy's High-ate Regency Hotel, Bowser's Seizures Palace Hotel, etc.
title: Hotel Mario

description: Far from the "multimedia" titles that formed the stock of the CDi's software library, The Apprentice is a plain old platform game with cartoony sprites that would not look out of place on contemporary 16-bit platforms. As Marvin, a wizard's apprentice, your master Mr. Wandburner gives you a series of tasks to complete (basically fetching an object found at the end of a level), spread out on six levels with three stages each, taking place on land, in the sea and in the air. In order to make your life in the aquatic levels easier, the wizard will turn you into a frog. In order to fly, you're equipped with a special flying helmet. Each level has a new weapon for you to use, ranging from the traditional magic wand to a rubber ball, a water pistol or even a laser gun. As in any normal platform game, each level has an end-boss, and between levels are bonus rounds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Right off the bat, it can be clearly seen that this is a very different CD-I game.

title: The Apprentice

description:
The game is based on the famous comics series about the brave and quick good cowboy Lucky Luke, who draws his gun faster than his shadow does.

After Dalton brothers have escaped from the jail and put their eyes on the gold mine of the town, you as always should chase and bring them to justice. Shooting the bad guys, jumping, and collecting the stars, you have to progress in 24 levels to the final goal. Animation and CD-audio are provided.

The game was made in English/French/German/Dutch.
title: Lucky Luke: The Video Game

description:
Clue is a full-motion video adaptation of the popular board game of the same name. There are three storylines with four difficulty levels, each with a unique solution making it altogether twelve different mysteries: The Hodded Madonna, Happy Ever After and Deadly Patent.

The movement system, where the player moves the cursor to a portion of the screen and clicks on it to move or turn to that direction is similar to the one found in the The 7th Guest. Inside the rooms the screen switches to a 360º panorama that can be scrolled by moving the cursor to its edges. Clicking on clocks starts a flashback video of what happened on the room before the crime was committed. Clicking on suspects brings up the interrogation screen, where they can be inquired about weapons, their alibis, etc. Clicking on secret passages transports the player to another room. Clicking on the bell calls the butler and the accusation menu, where the player chooses the weapon and the murderer. Afterwards, the butler informs if the player made the right choice. A notebook keeps track of all the information collected, and can be accessed at any time.

Each of the four difficulty levels have a different number of accusations available (3 on the easiest level, 1 on the hardest one). In the easier levels the room positions are fixed, while in the tougher levels they are random.

In each player's turn they can perform two moves, two actions or a action and a move. A move is defined by entering and leaving a room. A action is defined by examining items, interrogating suspects or watching a flashback.
title: Clue

alternate_titles.title: 3rd Degree: The interactive game show that puts you and your friends in the hot seat!

description: 3rd Degree is a multiplayer party game. The object of the game is to earn points by correctly predicting how other people would behave in embarrassing situations. Each player takes turns being in the "hot seat." The game displays a narrated slideshow of an amusing but awkward situation, then asks how the player would respond. He enters his response secretly, and another player (the "challenger") tries to predict what it was. Situations are drawn from the categories Love, Career, Money, and Family. Correct guesses earn points, but there's an element of bluffing, too. The game is aimed at adults and teenagers.
title: 3rd Degree

description:
Another version of the many Jeopardy! games released, this edition features full-motion video and the actual voice of Alex Trebek, but only shows him in the opening sequence and in the final round. The gameplay is like that of the TV show; two rounds of play with six categories with a final round at the end.

To answer the question the player must buzz in and put in the answer by using letters on the side of the screen. However, different from the other games is that there is no computer opponent to play against and Final Jeopardy doesn't have the answering system like the previous rounds. Instead it requires you to write it down using paper and a pen or pencil.
title: Jeopardy!

description:
Kether is a mixture of genres that include space flight, puzzle-solving and corridor shooting. The story takes place in space above the planet of Kether. An evil force by the name of Khork has kidnapped a princess by the name of Eta Carene and a young warrior by the name of Melkhor along with his space cruiser the Anterte must travel to five different temples orbiting in space above the planet, explore them and face off against the ultimate evil and save the princess.

When the player chooses which temple they want to explore, the game perspective takes on a space flight where the player must dodge against asteroids and collect green orbs scattered throughout to gain an extra energy boost in order to complete the stage. To enter the temple the player must solve a mysterious puzzle in a certain time limit, if the player is successful they can then enter the temple. Once inside the view goes to a first-person corridor shooter where the player, using an auto-map feature, will be presented with a choice of where to proceed. The goal is to reach the end of the temple and avoid enemies, if the player encounters an enemy however they can shoot at them to destroy them and proceed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Menus - start a new game, resume one, or change language

title: Kether

description: Caesars World of Gambling is much like the many other iterations. The player starts out with $500 to gamble in the famed Caesar's Palace in a variety of games such as Blackjack, Roulette, Craps, Slot Machines, etc. The game boasts photo realistic graphics of an actual casino, dealers and slot machines and has real-life odds applied to the game to give it a more realistic feel. It also features the ability for four different players to compete against each other.
title: Caesars World of Gambling

description:
In The Wacky World of Miniature Golf, the player can pick from a bevy of cartoon golfers and compete in 18 holes of miniature putt-putt golf in a variety of cartoon fantasy settings such as Egypt, prehistoric times, Atlantis, a prison and many more. The gameplay is more of an interactive cartoon where the player chooses the direction they wish to hit the ball and pressing the action button. If the player has chosen correctly they will hit it successfully and be treated to a cutscene where the ball will avoid the various obstacles and landing in the hole. Choosing the wrong path, however, will have their ball destroyed by a variety of obstacles and force the player to retry again.

A feature of the game is the voice acting talent of Eugene Levy who is most notable for his film appearances in the American Pie film series.
title: The Wacky World of Miniature Golf with Eugene Levy

alternate_titles.title: A Great Day at the Races: Play! Bet! Win! It's like a real race track!

description: A Great Day at the Races is an interactive tutorial for an aspiring gambler wanting to learn how to bet on horse races and learn advanced handicapping methods. It also features lessons on the history of horse racing and a dictionary where players can learn track jargon. It also features simulated races where players, six total, can try out their newly learned skills and try their hand at FMV races before trying it out on the real thing.

sample_screenshots.caption: The race is about to start

title: A Great Day at the Races

description: Effacer is a futuristic take on the classic paper and pencil game of hangman. The set-up has the player compete in a series of grammar games against aliens that have "committed crimes against grammar" by competing in games to learn proper nouns, adjectives and the like in the style of hangman. If the player chooses the right letters, the enemy alien will be zapped, but if the player picks the wrong one their character will start to be hanged. If they player chooses too many wrong letters, their character will be hanged and the game will be over.
title: Effacer: Hangman from the 25th Century

description:
Pinball is an aptly named pinball game for the CD-i. The game features four different tables: Cyber, Meltdown, Spring Break and Dogfight.

Cyber features a magnetic strip in the centre of the table which can hold your ball in its field at certain times. When it is you can try to deactivate it at the right time to guide your ball to the target you want to hit.

Meltdown features various chutes in a reactor that can be opened for more points.

Spring Break has a beach theme where you need to spell the words Spring Break.

Dogfight has a World War I airplane theme. At the table you are required to refuel your flippers from time to time or else they go dead.
title: Pinball

description: Alien Gate is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up in which you fly a spacecraft over alien terrain while shooting down enemies. The game comes with 25 levels. The enemies are spawned by a giant head that spits them out. The game sports a large variety of different enemies such as birds, bees, bombs, centipedes, UFOs and knives. When you defeat the head-boss the level is over.
title: Alien Gate

description: CD Shoot is a clay dove shooting game for the CD-i. The game has four game modes: sporting, Olympic trap, balltrap and English skeet. In the game clay doves are launched in the air and using a targeting crosshair you have to shoot them out of the sky.
title: CD Shoot

alternate_titles.title: ABC Sports Presente: L'Open de Palm Springs

description: ABC Sports Presents: The Palm Springs Open is a golfing game. The game makes use of real actors and photographic backgrounds. For each round you can select which club you want to use, and decide how you want to slice or hook the ball. The game features only one the Palm Springs course, which has 18 holes. Throughout the game your progress is verbally discussed on by two commentators.
title: ABC Sports Presents: The Palm Springs Open

description: Backgammon is a translation of the classical board game for the CD-i. The game allows the player to chose between three different opponents with each their own skill level. The game can be played in a first person perspective in which the opponents are displayed in an animated cartoon style. You can also play against a friend and choose for a top down view of the game board. A hint system is available when you don't know what to do and it is also possible to undo a turn when you change your mind.
title: Backgammon

alternate_titles.title: Battleship: Schiffeversenken mit der US Navy

description: Battleship is a conversion of the classic board game for the CD-i. The game plays exactly like the original board game. You take turns to fire on certain coordinates in the hope of hitting enemy ships. On the side of the screen there's a little window that shows short naval archive footage whenever you are firing or get hit. You can play against the computer or against a friend.
title: Battleship

description:
ABC Sports Presents: Power Hitter is a baseball game for the CD-i. The game only lets you bat, the rest of the game is taken care of by the AI. Before batting you are shown screens in which you have to select batter strategies and guess the type of pitch. After you are presented with a first-person view from the batter and you have to time your swing right. When you hit the rest of the action is shown through video clips from an actual match.

The game has no team licenses so all the teams are fictional. The game features commentary audio. The player doesn't play for a specific team, so either a single player bats for both teams or two players can alternate between the teams. The AI cannot take on the role of the batter.
title: ABC Sports Presents: Power Hitter

alternate_titles.title: Video Speedway: The Ultimate Racing Experience

description: Video Speedway is a racing game for the CD-i. The game is presented in a first person view from inside the fictional Formula One racing cars. Before each race the player has to run a trial lap on the track. Different tracks have different backgrounds such as the sky lines of New York, Paris, Geneva, Monument Valley and London.
title: Video Speedway

description: Alice in Wonderland is a game based on Lewis Carrol's classic story. The game is a side-scrolling adventure game in which the player controls Alice in her quest to return home from Wonderland. There's over 40 different characters to speak with including important characters from the book such as the Mad Hatter, the Cheshire Cat and the Queen of Spade. Not all the characters are all too willing to help you getting home.
title: Alice in Wonderland

description:
Mutant Rampage: Bodyslam is a 2D beat 'em up game for the CD-i.

In the year 2068 mutants have taken over the Earth. It is up to the player to kick some mutant butt in this side scrolling game. There are three different playable characters, two muscular men and a woman. It is also possible to change character at various spots in the game.

There are various different types of mutants to fight against such as a woman who hits you with her giant breasts, a man who farts in your face, spitting cavemen, and mutants who fight on even after literally losing their heads. Some mutants cacry weapons which they drop after they are defeated, which allows to player to make good use for them. Levels are ended by killing off a final boss.
title: Mutant Rampage: Bodyslam

alternate_titles.title: Monty Python's Invasion from the Planet Skyron or something completely different

description: Monty Python's Invasion from the Planet Skyron is an "interactive variety show" for the CD-i. You guide a group called the Lost Boys through nine levels in which you have to find out for yourself what to do. Each level consists of a screen in typical Monty Python art style. Clicking on elements may or may not instigate an event which could be either positive or negative. Behind the Lost Boys walks a sheep that keeps the score which goes up or down whenever you do something. Levels are broken up by sketches from the show. With enough points it is also possible to buy new sketches. There are several mini games to be found in the game such as memory, "guess who said it" and "guess the sketch" in which additional points can be scored.
title: Monty Python's Invasion from the Planet Skyron

description:
Family Games I is a collection of mini games for the whole family. The game features 10 different games from various different genres such as action and puzzle games. The games are:

  • Full Attack
  • Jokisen
  • Where's That Sound
  • Skid Kart
  • Captain Alphabet
  • Draw Stamp Color
  • Superslide
  • Morphon Invasion
  • Wizard
  • Hot Rocks
title: Family Games I

description:
Family Games II: Junkfood Jive is a sequel to Family Games I. This compilation of mini games comes with 5 different puzzle games. The five games are all versions or parodies of known games which are given a restaurant theme.

  • Super Exploding Pizza II is a strategical board game for up to four players. In their turn players can place ingredients on a triangular grid (which looks like a pizza). Whenever a triangle of a certain player features less ingredients than an adjacent triangle of another player, the other player takes over the triangle.

  • In Room Service you have to deliver a cup of hot cocoa to your mother. However she's hidden somewhere in the mansion and there are zombies roaming about. It's up to the player to find the mother before the time limit is up, while avoiding the zombies.

  • Buzz Off is a side-scrolling shooter in which you control a fly with superpowers. Your firepower can be improved through collecting power-ups. Hitting the scenery (a living room) or enemies kills the fly.

  • Draw Snack & Colour is a paint tool in which you can make your own drawings or color existing drawings.

  • Going Dutch: Mortal Pong is a Pong variant.
title: Family Games II: Junkfood Jive

description: Sport Freaks is a sports quiz game based on a Dutch television game show of the same name. The game includes all the questions that were written for the show but were never used. All the questions relate to a selection of 45 sports in 50 countries since the year 1900. The number of questions in the game (1250) equals 60 game show episodes. Using a sort of slot machine each turn a sport, year and country is chosen which you receive a question about. The emphasis lies on Dutch sports history.
title: Sport Freaks

description: Christmas Country is a 2D platform game for the CD-i with a Christmas setting. The game is aimed at younger children. The player has to walk and run around and defeat enemies. The game comes with 16 levels.
title: Christmas Country

description: Atlantis: The Last Resort is a first person shooter for the CD-i. In the future presented in the game people go on illusory dream vacations. But when a virus is brought into the system that allows these vacations, all hell breaks loose. So the government decides to send in the meanest criminal they have in detention: The player. The player gets a chance to redeem himself by going into the virtual holiday and destroy anything that is corrupting it, such as undead skeletons. The game features crude graphics and gameplay similar to Wolfenstein 3D. In between missions you are treated with pre rendered 3D animations.
title: Atlantis: The Last Resort

description:
Arcade Classics is a collection of three classic Namco arcade games converted to the CD-i:

  • Ms. Pac-Man
  • Galaxian
  • Galaga
title: Arcade Classics

description:
Christmas Crisis is a 2D plaftorm game with a Christmas theme. The player plays as Santa Claus and has to disarm twenty-four presents that have been rigged with explosives by the malicious Dr. Rubberchicken. As Santa the player is armed with snowballs which can be used to knock out evil toys sent to stop you in your path by Dr. Rubberchicken.

Aside from snow, which allows the player to replenish his snow balls there's various other types of pickups that can be collected such as treasure. When enough treasure is collected the player receives a password that allows him to restart the game from that level after he has died.

The game features new themes for each level and in the end the player has to fight a final boss. Most levels are vertically orientated and thus allow for lots of jumping. In between levels there's some 3D bonus levels in which the player rides Santa's sleigh in first person perspective. The sleigh moves along a rail and the player has to dodge obstacles.
title: Christmas Crisis

description:
Flintstones Jetsons: Timewarp is an graphical adventure game based on the two popular cartoons The Flintstones and The Jetsons.

In the game Fred Flintstone and George Jetson have switched places in time and space. It is for the player to set things right again.
title: Flintstones Jetsons: Timewarp

description: Lettergreep is a word puzzle game in which you have to make as many words as possible from given syllables. For each correct word the player gains a number of points, but he loses points when he constructs an incorrect word. More points are awarded for words using more syllables. Once the time limit is up the player can no longer make new words and his score is final. The game is in Dutch and thus only features Dutch words and syllables.
title: Lettergreep

description:
Connect Four is a digital version of the 1974 Milton Bradley board game of the same name. In the game players take turn dropping coloured discs on a vertical playing field while trying to get four of them in a row either horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

This version can be played against a friend or against the computer. There are three difficulty levels for the computer opponent. Players can pick their own colour of choice.
title: Connect Four

description: Master Labyrinth is a digital version of the 1991 board game of the same name by Ravensburger. The digital version plays just like the board game. Players alternate turns in which they can shift rows or columns of the game board, which represents the layout of the maze. Scattered around the maze are various magical components that have to be collected by the players. Cards determine which components need to be collected. The player who collects most components wins the game.
title: Master Labyrinth

description: Accelerator is a 2D top down action racing game. The cars in the game feature weapons so while racing the player not only has to focus on the road but also has to dodge enemy bullets. When a car gets hit it is disabled for a couple of seconds. When this happens a lot the car explodes and the race is over for that participant. When the player performs well he can buy weapons himself and improve his driving skills. The player can choose between 8 different drivers to play with, each of them has its own abilities such as traction, acceleration, speed and armour. The game features 10 different tracks to race on.
title: Accelerator

description:
Whack a Bubble is a paddle and ball game in the vein of Breakout. You control a paddle at the bottom of the screen and have to remove bubbles at the top by bouncing a ball against them. If the ball leaves the screen at the bottom you loose a life.

The game comes with a 100 levels and 3 difficulties. The game also features a two player mode where players play against each other.
title: Whack a Bubble

description: Striker Pro is a soccer game for the CD-i. The game has a top-down view with the goals at the top and bottom of the playing field. In the game you can choose from 64 national teams to play with. There are various game modes such as friendly, world league and world cup. Optionally the game can be played in a 6 vs 6 mode. The game can be played against the AI or another player.
title: Striker Pro

description: Domino is a digital conversion of the classical tile laying game of Dominoes. Each rectangular tile has a number of dots on both long ends. In turns players place one of their tiles on the table. Tiles must connect to evenly numbered edges. The first player to lose all his tiles wins the game. When the player can't place any of his tiles he has to pass.
title: Domino

description:
Great British Golf: Middle Ages - 1940 is an encyclopedia about Golf in Britain from 1457 to 1940. It comes with two games: a trivia and an animated golf game.

The encyclopedia part features 92 auditory and visual articles, the quiz features 500 multiple choice questions with added audio and visuals. All questions can be answered through carefully studying the encyclopedic part.

The golf game lets you play at the Old Course in St Andrews using historical figures and equipment.

70 of the 92 digital articles and most of the menu structure was taken directly from the British Golf Museum in Scotland. Additional articles were photographed from three dimensional displays in the museum.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's possible that the ball ends up here, in the water

title: Great British Golf: Middle Ages - 1940

description:
Caesars World of Boxing is a boxing game that lets you box at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas.

There's two parts to this game an arcade boxing game in which you have to win matches. And a strategic part where you are approached by managers, trainers, reporters, high rollers and groupies and have to make decisions on their advice, proposals and temptations.
title: Caesars World of Boxing

description:
Jigsaw: The Ultimate Electronic Puzzle is a collection of digital Jigsaw puzzles. The game allows you to choose a picture from its library and select the number of pieces (3,000 to 15,000) and shape of the pieces.

The game has a simple aid function that shows the correct location for a piece with a simple button press.

The game is accompanied with a soothing New Age soundtrack.
title: Jigsaw: The Ultimate Electronic Puzzle

description:
Tangram is a digital conversion of the traditional Chinese puzzle game of the same name.

Using a set of seven shapes (two large, one medium, one small triangle, one square and a parallelogram) the player is tasked with recreating various two dimensional figures. The player is only given a silhouette of the figure and has to figure out the position of each piece. All figures use all pieces.

The game has five difficulty levels and features a free form where you can design your own figures. You rotate the individual shapes with the cursor and can ask for hints.
title: Tangram

description:
Voetbal is an encyclopedia about soccer and its statistics that includes two games.

The encyclopedic part narrates the history of soccer, the 10 top players of all time (such as Maradonna, Pele and Cruyff) with many audio/visual references. The rules of the game are also explained in much detail. Alone or with friends you can test yourself on your soccer knowledge through a quiz about the rules.

It is also possible to shoot penalties with Jean-Marie Pfaff as the goalie. The first player to score five goals is the winner.
title: Voetbal

description:
Strip Poker Live is a strip poker game. There are six women to play against: a Swedish blonde, a Mediterranean brunette, a Maui, a Parisian and an athletic girl.

Like most strip poker games you play poker against the AI and as you are winning the opponent will gradually lose pieces of clothing.
title: Strip Poker Live

description:
De Zaak van Sam is an interactive detective story. The player takes on the role of private detective Sam D. Philips who has been asked to find Monica. Monica is the beautiful wife of mafia boss Antonio Baresi.

The game is an interactive movie in which the player has to make the right decisions or see an untimely end. The game takes its style from Film Noir Hollywood detectives from the 30s and 40s.
title: De Zaak van Sam

description: The Dark Fables of Aesop is a collection of twelve fables from Æsop (Greece, 620-560 BC). The stories are presented with illustrations, animations and Jazz music. Included with the disk are 60 maze games with three different difficulties.
title: The Dark Fables of Aesop

description: More Dark Fables from Aesop is the sequel to The Dark Fables of Aesop and includes 12 new tales from the ancient Greek storyteller Æsop. The stories are narrated by famous actor Danny Glover with music by Ron Carter. The stories are shown with illustrations and animations. Many of the illustrations can be turned into sliding puzzles. There are three difficulty levels for these puzzles.
title: More Dark Fables from Aesop

description:
Laser Lords is a comedic adventure game that takes place in space.

In the game the player takes on the role of a human hitchhiker who is abducted from a desert road by a space ship. The plot will unfold to have the player save the universe. An evil and ancient being called Sarpedon is trying to obtain a certain crystal that will allow him to possess the entire universe. Needless to say the player has to prevent this from happening. The game requires you to explore seven planets, each of which has settings that resemble our own mythology and history such as the planet Argos that looks much like ancient Greece. Each world is full of references to historic events and stories.

The game combines adventure game elements with platform game elements. The player has 9 lives. When you run out the game is over, but you can save and load the game to prevent from having to start the game over completely. You can collect and trade items to solve puzzles. When talking to NPCs highlighted words in their dialogue can be remembered. This places them in your "word bank" and allows you to ask other NPCs about those subjects. All the NPCs are fully voiced. Actors often impersonated famous voices like those of Arnold Schwarzenegger, John Wayne and Gregory Peck.

In spite of its "Ages 12 and up" rating, the game is filled with dark humor, sex, drugs, homosexuality and gambling references. It is even possible to play Russian Roulette in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hive is a strange planet of bees

title: Laser Lords

description: Ultra CD-i Soccer is a top-down soccer game. The game features 72 European teams to play with against the computer or a friend. The game allows the player to play a total competition with all the teams, and to create his own competition with up to four teams.
title: Ultra CD-i Soccer

description:
Sargon Chess is a chess engine inspired by the Mesopotamian king Sargon that allows you to play a game of chess.

The game features 16 different difficulty levels. A special Novice level gives you starter tips and allows you to take back moves and changes sides. It is also possible to construct Chess challenges and let "Sargon" solve them.

The game can be played with 3 distinct chess sets which are displayed in a quasi-3D perspective.
title: Sargon Chess

description: NFL Hall of Fame Football takes the player on a virtual tour of the NFL Hall of Fame located in Canton, Ohio. They can explore the Hall of Fame and view photographs and stats of some of the most famous NFL teams off all-time up to the 1990 season. It also lists 145 of the greatest players of the day and provides a virtual tour guide complete with voice over. Players can also play an actual football game using every player, team and league mentioned in the Hall of Fame and have players and teams from different eras compete on the gridiron.
title: NFL Hall of Fame Football

description: Text Tiles is a strategic puzzle game in which players have to spell words. Using a set of given letters the players have to form words, much like Scrabble. This is done on a 12x12 board. The letters can be used to either form a long word or multiple short words. Points are scored for each correct word. Letters are received one at a time and disappear again after a certain amount of time creating a time pressure for forming words. The player can see what his next letter is going to be so he can plan ahead. The game can be played with up to four players.
title: Text Tiles

description: Tell Me Why One is an interactive trivia game. There are over 175 questions that need answering. Questions in the game are typical questions that curious children might ask. They come in five categories: our world, how things work, the zoo, how things began and the human body. Questions are supported with audio and visuals. The game comes with over 3 hours of fact filled presentations and interactive exhibits.
title: Tell Me Why One

description: Tell Me Why Two is an interactive trivia game and sequel to Tell Me Why One. The game comes with an additional 175+ questions that need answering. Questions in the game are typical questions that curious children might ask. They come in five categories: our world, how things work, the zoo, how things began and the human body. Questions are supported with audio and visuals. The game comes with over 3 hours of fact filled presentations and interactive exhibits.
title: Tell Me Why Two

description:
Axis and Allies is a digital conversion of the board game of the same name. The game takes place during World War II and up to five players take on the different superpowers of that time (Germany, Japan, USSR, USA and UK). With less than five players the AI takes care of the remaining superpowers. Players can work together cooperatively or battle each other in this World War II simulation.

In this turn based strategy games the players' objectives is to conquer enemy territories. Conflicts are fought through the rolling of dice. The game comes with numerous stock footage of actual combat in World War II. This is displayed during said conflicts.
title: Axis and Allies

description:
Golden Oldies I is collection of two games that mimic the game mechanics of classic arcade games. The games are:

  • Guardian, a remake of Defender.
  • Invaders, a remake of Space Invaders

Both games have modernized graphics over the original, while the gameplay stays mostly the same. In Guardian you fly around on a horizontally scrolling background shooting at enemies. In Invaders you hover about at the bottom of the screen and shoot enemies that come descending from the sky. There are three bunkers to hide in, until they are shot to bits.
title: Golden Oldies I

description:
Golden Oldies II is a sequel to Golden Oldies I. Like the previous title it is a collection of two games that mimic the game mechanics of classic arcade games. For part II the games are:

  • Blockbuster, a remake of Arkanoid.
  • Bughunt, a remake of Centipede.

Both games have modernized graphics over the original, while the gameplay stays mostly the same. In Blockbuster the player moves a paddle left and right to bounce a ball against blocks at the top of the screen. Blocks are destroyed when hit by the ball and in order to win all blocks have to be destroyed. Some blocks contain powerups that make it easier for the player.

In Bughunt the player tries to kill centipedes by shooting it from the bottom of the screen. Whenever shot the centipedes lose parts of their body, making them harder to hit for a successive hit.
title: Golden Oldies II

description:
The Joker's Wild! is a trivia game based on the 70-80s game show of the same name. The game is hosted by Wink Martindale.

In the game players answer multiple choice questions stated by the host. Categories for the questions are determined by a giant slot machine with three wheels. Each wheel features five categories and a joker. Each round a player pulls the lever and picks one of the resulting categories. The joker counts as a wild card.

When an answer is correctly given to a question the player receives a certain amount of money. If the category is shown on the slot machine two or three times (2 or 3 of a kind) the scores are multiplied. When a player answers incorrectly his opponent may give a shot at the question and steal the money.

Unlike the original show this video game adaptation can be played with up to four players. Of course no money can be won with this video game, but there is a high score list that keeps track of all the best scores.
title: The Joker's Wild!

description:
The Joker's Wild Jr. is a trivia game based on the 70-80s game show The Joker's Wild. The game is hosted by Marc Summers.

Gameplay is the same as for the adult version The Joker's Wild. In the game players answer multiple choice questions stated by the host. Categories for the questions are determined by a giant slot machine with three wheels. Each wheel features five categories and a joker. Each round a player pulls the lever and picks one of the resulting categories. The joker counts as a wild card.

When an answer is correctly given to a question the player receives a certain amount of money. If the category is shown on the slot machine two or three times (2 or 3 of a kind) the scores are multiplied. When a player answers incorrectly his opponent may give a shot at the question and steal the money.

Unlike the original show this video game adaptation can be played with up to four players. Of course no money can be won with this video game, but there is a high score list that keeps track of all the best scores. Major differences with the adult version are the change of host, easier questions and some more children friendly graphics.
title: The Joker's Wild Jr.

description: The Lost Ride is a rail shooter game where you are literally on rails. The player is put inside a futuristic roller coaster and has to shoot anything that might get in his way. The game comes with three different themes for its levels: Mine World, Aqua World and Future World. Each world has different seamless prerendered 3D backgrounds that feature as backdrops for the shooting action. At the end of each stage a Boss creature has to be killed, which will unlock a bonus ride. These random generated tracks are maze-like and require you to choose a direction at various points. They are presented in surround sound so they really feel like being inside a roller coaster.
title: The Lost Ride

description: Tetsuo Gaiden is a shoot 'em up in the style of Galaga. The player controls a small spaceship at the bottom of the screen and has too shoot enemies that fly around on the screen in predefined patterns. The enemies also fire at the player so he has to dodge their attacks simultaneously. The game can be played in classic mode where the background is represented by a static star field, or the game can be played with a FMV of asteroids in the background.
title: Tetsuo Gaiden

description: Alfapet is a Swedish word puzzle similar to Scrabble. Like in Scrabble players make words from randomly received letters and place them on the playing board. Words are worth points and each letter has its own value. The value of each letter is different from Scrabble and also the board is different with harmful tiles and quadruple modifiers. Tiles with arrows or stop symbols allow you to respectively lay words in a corner and behind other words without using their letters. The game uses a Swedish dictionary for words and can be played with up to four players.
title: Alfapet

alternate_titles.title: L'Ange et le Demon: Aventures au Mont-Saint-Michel

description:
L'Ange et le Demon is a French adventure game that takes place around the Mont-Saint-Michel in Normandy, France. It is up to the player to find an angelic sword that is stolen by the forces of evil.

The game world is made up from 2500 photographs from the area and a large number of puzzles that the player has to solve to end this conflict between good and evil.

sample_screenshots.caption: The map shows our current position
On the roof of the main church building
The demon is our main adversary

title: L'Ange et le Demon

description:
Big Bang Show combines both arcade action gameplay with a historical quiz in two different game modes.

In the arcade game the player controls a ball of energy called Sparkie. Sparkie is invented by Professor Albertus the host of the game. Using logic and reflexes you have to move Sparkie around the level avoiding obstacles and collecting objects.

In the quiz game Professor Albertus asks questions which have to be answered. There are questions in the following categories* Big Bang

  • Prehistory
  • Middle age
  • 20th century
  • Future

Enough questions about one category have to be answered to jump to the next.
title: Big Bang Show

description: Do You Remember the '60s? is a quiz game with questions about the 1960s for the whole family.
title: Do You Remember the '60s?

description: Foqus is a party game based on the Swedish game show of the same name. In the game players have to guess partially obscured pictures similar to the game show Get the Picture.
title: Foqus

description: Gewetensvragen is a Dutch quiz test about moral questions pertaining World War II. In this title players are described situations during the war and have to make decisions. Questions include touchy subjects such as helping paratroopers, hiding Jews, helping injured anti-Semites, etc. The aim of this title is to show the users that in times of war it can be very difficult to make the right choices.
title: Gewetensvragen

description: Girl's Club is a fantasy dating simulation game starring American actress Heidi Lucas. It is however not possible to date Heidi, since this game is aimed at girls and allows the player to date thirty different men.
title: Girl's Club

description:
Great American Golf 1 is an interactive encyclopedia about the early days of golf in the United States. This part covers players, events and courses from before the 1960s. Each subject is explained with full motion videos and highlights taken from TV.

Additionally you can play golf at the Far Hill Course against your competitors Iron Byron, The Babe and Ben. Or test your knowledge about golf history with the quiz.
title: Great American Golf 1

description:
Great American Golf 2 is an interactive encyclopedia about the modern days of golf in the United States. This part covers players, events and courses from the 1960s onward. Each subject is explained with full motion videos and highlights taken from TV.

Additionally you can play golf at Pebble Beach against your competitors Iron Byron, The Babe and Ben. Or test your knowledge about golf history with the quiz.
title: Great American Golf 2

description: Hieroglyph is a puzzle game with an Egyptian theme. Like in the board game Master Labyrinth the player has control over the layout of a maze that's made out of different tiles. The player has to help the puppet inside to escape. The game offers three difficulties: slow, normal and fast.
title: Hieroglyph

description: Goal: FIFA World Cup Soccer Quiz Game is a quiz game about the FIFA World Cup. In the game two players play a match of soccer against each other. But in stead of directly controlling the players, a player is given three choices in a particular situation. Depending on the player's choice he's presented with an easy, medium or hard multiple choice question about the World Cup event. Answering the question correctly makes the choice a success. More difficult questions have a greater benefit on the field. Players can choose for a game of five, ten or fifteen minutes.
title: Goal: FIFA World Cup Soccer Quiz Game

description: Le journal interactif 94 et Le jeu des stars de l'info is a collection of newsreels from the French broadcast company TF1. In this multimedia title you can review all the news subject of 1994. You can also create your own news show using footage from the same year. The goal is to to impress the chief editor.
title: Le journal interactif 94 et Le jeu des stars de l'info

description: Magic Eraser is a graphical puzzle action game. The game features six famous Russian paintings that are spotted with ink. It is up to the player to use his magic eraser to remove the ink. Meanwhile ink bottles continuously splash the painting when they come in contact with the eraser. So the player has to be careful where he moves.
title: Magic Eraser

description:
Making the Grade is a simulation game that puts the player in the position of a general manager of BP (British Petroleum) that has been tasked to construct and run a chemical plant for a ten year period. In this serious game the player learns everything he needs to know about management through a series of interactive scenarios. The game is presented in Full Motion Video sequences and features a large cast of co-workers with each their own personalities. The game features three phases. In the startup phase the player chooses a building site and a general manager. In the second phase he has to construct the plant and in the final phase he goes into production and has to make a profit. If the player doesn't do very well he can be fired at any time, which means it's game over. There are three different difficulty levels.

At the end of the ten years the player is awarded with a score. The score depends on three criteria: Profit, PR skills and environmental issues. Your final score could be sent to BP. For a while after release a prize of a 1000 British Pounds was awarded every three months to the player with the highest score.

sample_screenshots.caption: An office map, great for planning sexcapades without HR finding out. Can you handle a hot steamy office romance? I bet you can, sailor!
Trish likes to smile. The smiles hide her sadness at Colin's alcohol addiction. She knows it's not healthy for him, and she loves him.

title: Making the Grade

description: Name That Tune is a musical pop quiz hosted by Bob Goen. It is an adaptation of the US TV show of the same name. In this game the player is quizzed on 160 different categories and will hear 600 different songs from the '50s to the '90s. The show features four different rounds with different gameplay.
title: Name That Tune

description: NFL Football Trivia Challenge '94-'95 Edition is a trivia game with an National Football League license. It is an updated version of NFL Football Trivia Challenge with new questions and footage. Gameplay is fairly identical to the previous game. Either player can pick his favourite team to play with. TV commentators Pat Summerall and Tom Bookshier describe various situations in play accompanied by 1,200 images and 300 Full Motion Video clips. 1,500 multiple choice questions are waiting to be answered in the game. For each correct answer the player gains yardage in the game and increases his chances of scoring a point. The player with most points after 60 questions wins the game. There are three different difficulty levels to play at.
title: NFL Football Trivia Challenge '94-'95 Edition

description:
Pyramid Adventures: Episode 1 - Treasures of the Lost Pyramid is the first and only part in the Pyramid Adventures series. It was never met with a planned sequel. The game is an adaptation of a book by Jack Sughrue. The story is about the world famous archaeologist Dr. Olivia Pitt and her nephew Dash Daniels who discover an ancient pyramid in Egypt. They get trapped inside it and Dr. Pitt gets kidnapped by the the evil pharaoh Antu. It's up to Dash and his cat to help her and escape the pyramid.

The game plays as a typical side-scrolling platform game with an educational twist. The game's main theme is nutrition and the game was sponsored by the USA National Cancer Institute. In the game the player controls Dash and has to defeat Antu's evil minions and restore order inside the pyramid. Dash is spiritually aided by the gods Tofu and Yam. With his slingshot he can defeat enemies. Dash can also pick up items and store them in your backpack. Collectable items include bonus lives and gold. Gold can be used to buy important items need for survival such as a bedroll. Dash can examine everything in the pyramid and each examination provides further clues for finding out about the pyramids secrets.

Dash has to eat and sleep regularly to stay alive. So he has to look for healthy food. He also has to feed several of the creatures inside the pyramid (as part of restoring the balance), such as a sphinx and Sebek the Devourer. In doing so the player learns about the USDA food group pyramid.

The pyramid also features an arcade where the player can play mini-games. With each mini-game gold can be earned.
title: Pyramid Adventures: Episode 1 - Treasures of the Lost Pyramid

description:
Scotland Yard Interactive is a digital version of the board game Scotland Yard by Ravensburger. Mr. X is London's most wanted criminal and it's up to the players to catch him.

In the game each turn players try to chase down Mr. X. Players have tokens for use of taxis, buses and the tube. But when the tokens run out the funding for the hunt is up and Mr. X. goes free. Mr. X. receives all used tokens and thus it becomes easier for him to travel throughout the game. But as a clue to the other players he must show which token he uses each turn. Mr. X. has a limited number of black tokens which could stand for any means of transportation. At five specific times during the game, Mr. X. has to reveal his current position. The detectives win when they land on the same square as Mr. X. Mr. X. wins when all tokens are spend up.

This digital conversion features photographs and digital animations of London. The game can be played with up to six players and both Mr. X. and the detectives can be A.I. controlled.
title: Scotland Yard Interactive

description:
Shaolin's Road is a action adventure that takes place in medieval China. When Tsu Yu's father, a powerful warlord, is murdered and his sword stolen, Tsu Yu vows to avenge his father's murder. The player (as Tsu Yu) will have to learn Shaolin Kung Fu to do so.

The player has to roam the land and speak with other Kung Fu heroes, who will most likely only scoff at the player. Occasionally they will send the player on a trial which comes in the form of a mini game, such as shooting a snake with a bow and arrow, engaging in Kung Fu fighting and karate, throwing stars, performing calligraphy and playing memory to learn Chinese symbols.

Completing challenges changes the color of the player's belt and gives him more recognition with the other fighters allowing him to progress further. It also unlocks new pieces of the map you can use to travel to new areas.

sample_screenshots.caption: The test at the Dragon temple is the recognition of Chinese characters
We are choosing not just the color of our belt, but a difficulty level as well
The guru explains our main task

title: Shaolin's Road

description: Strip-Poker Pro is a typical game of strip poker. You play the game of poker, but for each hand lost a player loses a piece of clothing. There are five computer opponents; three women and two men. Each of the computer opponents is displayed in full motion video.
title: Strip-Poker Pro

description:
The Ultimate Noah's Ark is a digital version of the picture-book of the same name by artist Mike Wilks. Like the book the player is presented with a large drawing of Noah's Ark. On the Ark are 354 different animal species to be found. All but one of them have a mate. It's up to the user to find which animal is missing his mate.

The original drawing can be broken up into 256 different screen-wide detail close-ups. In addition to the drawing this software title comes with additional information for all the animals including videos of them in their natural habitats.
title: The Ultimate Noah's Ark

description:
Zenith is a game which defies traditional genre descriptions. Players control a silver ball, akin to a pinball, with a viewpoint looking directly down on the ball from above. Unlike pinball, where the ball falls vertically in front of the player, in Zenith continuously bounces towards and away from the player viewpoint. Imagine dropping a golf ball on a hard floor while looking at it directly from above - and then watching as the ball bounces directly upwards along that straight line of sight.

There are no flippers or any other traditional elements similar to pinball. Instead the player controls the ball directly. While the bouncing cannot be controlled, the ball can be moved in any of the four cardinal directions. To progress players need to time the bounces on hard surfaces then push in the required direction to pass over bottomless pits and acid/lava pools. Time your movement poorly and the ball will miss connecting with a solid surface and plunge into death, losing the player a life.

The screen cannot be scrolled horizontally, only vertically. As a result, the levels are like long vertical fields, and some levels are made up of multiple fields which are not directly connected. Later levels also feature warp gates which take you to different parts of that level, or to entirely different vertical fields. Power-ups and score increase items can be collected in the levels.

Zenith plays similarly to Bounder and its sequel Re-bounder on 8-bit home computers, albeit with a great sense of depth and speed, and the ability to scroll the screen in reverse.
title: Zenith

description: Muzzy is an edutainment tool for English people to learn French. The game offers 30 interactive lessons presented by the BBC's friendly green monster Muzzy and his friends. Lessons include story segments and games.
title: Muzzy: Learn French the Fun Way

alternate_titles.title: The Berenstain Bears: Bij de Berenstain Beren Thuis - Thuis en bij Jou
The Berenstain Bears: Selbst ist der Bär

description:
The Berenstain Bears: On Their Own is an interactive story book for children based on the popular children's book series.

A yearly fair has come to Bear country, but nobody has the time to accompany brother and sister bear to go to it. Mother bear agrees that they can go on their own if they prove they can be responsible.

The game includes 29 educational games for children. With each successful completion the player can win stars. Games include cleaning their virtual room, catching the bus to school, matching the alphabet, reading the clock and others. Initially all the games are around the house, but once the player has shown his responsibility, more games at the fair are unlocked.
title: The Berenstain Bears: On Their Own

description: Die CD-i mit der Maus: Auf dem Bauernhof is an educational title for children. In the game players get to learn all about activities on a farm. Through a number of movies, animations and mini-games the players learn such trivial knowledge as how bread and cheese are made and where milk and honey come from. Also included are some sing-along songs in the same theme. Everything is presented by "Die Maus" (the mouse) a well known German children's figure at the time.
title: Die CD-i mit der Maus: Auf dem Bauernhof

description: European Party is an interactive way to learn different European languages. In the game the players have to prepare a party and are tasked with activities such as creating invitation cards, making cookies, preparing surprises and organizing games. During all this the players will be learning various different languages.
title: European Party

description: Face Kitchen allows players to cook up faces. In Uby the French chef's kitchen players will find an abundance of ears, noses, mouths and facial accessories in the cupboards and refrigerator. Uby will mix up whatever you choose to create a new face. There are thousands of different faces that can be made. Each face sings a song, tells a tale, cracks a joke or tells a tale after being baked in the oven. Face Kitchen is meant for children but can be enjoyed by people of all ages.
title: Face Kitchen

description:
Henri Dès: Les bêtises is a children's title featuring multiple fun activities.

Primarily the game features 12 songs by French singer-songwriter Henri Dès. Each song is fully illustrated and accompanied by its lyrics to aid in singing along. There are dozens of games to play for the whole family, which are accompanied by the songs.

Additionally the game features a number of dessert recipes.
title: Henri Dès: Les bêtises

description:
ik, mik, Letterland is a Dutch educational title for children who are just starting to learn to read (ages 5-9). It makes use of the "Veilig Leren Lezen" (also known as "Maan Roos Vis") learning package which is used in most schools in the Netherlands and Flanders.

In this games players take on the role of a brave girl called Mik. It is up to Mik to save the people of Loria who live in the Lorian hills. They are threatened by the monster Karbonkel who is jealous of Loria's reading and writing skills and has thus stolen all letters.

As Mik players travel to seven different worlds in which they can play a variety of word/letter games, listen to songs and watch animations and movies.
title: ik, mik, Letterland

description: Learn magic from Max the Magician in Max Magic. In this title suitable for the whole family, renown magician Max Maven teaches 14 customizable magic tricks to the players. You can let Max perform his own show, or create a show together with Max, where the player secretly controls the actions with the CDi's remote controller to baffle the audience. Tricks include mind reading and guessing someones Zodiac sign. The player can setup Max to address him by his first name.
title: Max Magic

description:
Moses: The Exodus is a an educational title for children in which they learn about the classic story from the Old Testament. Aside from the actual story, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The main game is a point-and-click adventure game in which you explore the insides of a pyramid. You have to find your way around and interact with characters inside the pyramid that help you.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: Moses: The Exodus

description:
David and Goliath is a an educational title for children in which they learn about the classic story from the old Testament. Aside from the actual story, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The main game is a board game in which you play as David and have to race Goliath to the finish.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: David and Goliath

description:
The Story of Samson is a an educational title for children in which they learn about the classic story from the old Testament. Aside from the actual story, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The main game is called Riddler's Race. In the game the player takes on the role of a harpist on the way to Samson's wedding. The harpist is being pursued however, and every time the pursuers catch up with the harpist the player has to answer a Bible related riddle to continue.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: The Story of Samson

description:
Mother Goose: Hidden Pictures is an animated activity book for children. Linda Arnold sings twenty-six popular Mother Goose nursery rhymes. Each rhyme is accompanied with a hidden object puzzle. Players have to find a selection of hidden objects in the illustrated backgrounds. When all the objects are found the background begins to animate to reward the player.

Included songs: Jack Be Nimble, Hickory Dickory Dock, Little Miss Muffet, Wee Willie Winkie, Old King Cole and others.
title: Mother Goose: Hidden Pictures

description:
Mother Goose: Rhymes to Color is an animated activity book for children. Linda Arnold sings twenty-six popular Mother Goose nursery rhymes. Each rhyme is accompanied with a coloring puzzle. Players use the controller to colour in the pictures, once this is done the picture becomes animated to reward the player.

Songs include: Little Bo-Peep, Old Woman Who Loves In A Shoe, Humpty Dumpty, Simple Simon and Pat-a-Cake.
title: Mother Goose: Rhymes to Color

description:
Retourtje Mali is a Dutch educational title that tries to educate children about life in Africa. Mali is taken as an example of life in the African Sahel and the game offers information about the region and its people. The main goal behind the title is to remove the negative prejudices most people have about third world countries.

The main program allows users to virtually visit Mali. Additionally it includes a game mode in which players are asked questions. To answer the questions players must go on a virtual expedition to the city of Ségou and the village Missango. Players can try to find clues to the answers they seek by clicking on hot spots on the village map and the photo album of the Keita family. Each time when they do they are presented with a movie or slide-show that teaches them more about life in the village.
title: Retourtje Mali

alternate_titles.title: Les Aventures de Sandy Au Cirque
Les Aventures de Sandy Au Cirque: Je choisis et décide ce qui se passe dans mes dessins animés !
Sandy's Circus Adventure: Create you own cartoon adventure

description: Sandy's Circus Adventure is a children's title about a friendly sea lion called Sandy. Sandy is lost in the circus and together with the player she will explore it. Sandy can have fun with the clowns, be launched out of a giant cannon, disappear inside a magician's hat, juggle and much more circus related activities. Every activity is accompanied with cartoon animations and digital music and sound effects. Furthermore there are some more active and creative activities such as color drawings, creating short animations and creating clowns faces by making combinations of facial features.
title: Sandy's Circus Adventure

description: Paint School I is a title that allows children to paint on their CD-i. There are three different categories available: Cuddly animals, wild animals and water world. Each category has many different drawings to colour, but the player can also opt to create his own drawing from scratch. There's 32,000 colors to pick from. Each drawing can be turned into a sliding puzzle which has to be solved. The whole package is accompanied with an up-beat soundtrack.
title: Paint School I

alternate_titles.title: All the Fun of the Fair: Engels voor Kinderen

description:
All the Fun of the Fair is a Dutch educational title. The game is designed for early teens to learn some vocabulary of the English language. It is meant to prepare children for English courses they receive at the "middelbare school" (high school).

In the game the player joins up with four friends who visit a fair. The game features a variety of games and exercises that provide a basis in vocabulary and pronunciation.

In Roller Coaster the player has to color roller coaster carts and try to discover in which Susan and Robin are hiding.

Ghost Train is a simple board game where the players progress by throwing a dice and moving across a board. At certain spaces activities have to be performed, the activities are announced in English. The focus in this game lies on learning the names for various colors.

Bumper Cars allows you to play bingo and learn the English name for numbers.

Kim's Game is a memory game played at the food stand. And there's also a multiple choice quiz to be played with Professor Planning.
title: All the Fun of the Fair

description:
Noah's Ark is a an educational title for children in which they learn about the classic story from the old Testament. Aside from the actual story, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: Noah's Ark

description:
The Story of Jonah is a an educational title for children in which they learn about the classic story from the old Testament. Aside from the actual story, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: The Story of Jonah

description:
Shipwreck is an educational title about electricity and magnetism for children of 8 years and older. In this game children learn the principles, terms and practical applications of electricity. The game is based on the educational children's books by Two-Can Publishing.

In the main game the player is shipwrecked on an island and has to repair a broken motorboat in order to escape from the evil clutches of "Ohm". The player will have to put all his knowledge of electricity to good use to succeed.
title: Shipwreck

description:
Soundtrap is an educational title about sound for children of 8 years and older. In this game children learn the principles, terms and practical applications of sound. The game is based on the educational children's books by Two-Can Publishing.

After a series of interactive lessons, the player can have a go at the main game: An adventure game in which the player has to apply his knew knowledge to the test.
title: Soundtrap

description:
Stickybear: Family Fun - Games is a children's title based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. Unlike other Stickybear licensees which are more educative in character this game is all about having fun.

The game offers a variety of mini-games such as Hangman, Tic Tac Toe and Hippity Hop, a peg jumping game. All the games are accompanied with familiar Stickybear characters which are fully animated and accompanied with amusing sound effects.
title: Stickybear: Family Fun - Games

description: Stickybear: Math is an educational title for children ages 6 and up based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. In the game Stickybear helps teach the player mathematics with the help of a variety of math games. Including simple graphical sums to an arcade platform game.
title: Stickybear: Math

description:
Stickybear: Reading is an educational title for children ages four to eight, based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. The game features three different reading activities, all accompanied with cartoon animations, music and comical sound effects.

Using the Sentence Builder players can create their own sentences from nouns and verbs, which will be read out loud by Stickybear. Each sentence features an animation. In Sarah's Word Book players can click on items which then animate, their names are said and displayed textually. Finally in Word Bop, players use a magical cannon that turns items into words and vice versa. The game features both the English and Spanish language to play in.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu - choose options or interact with characters
The sentences are drawn and read out for us by the game.
Stickybear enjoys his book where some dancing animals come to life.

title: Stickybear: Reading

description: Stickybear: Preschool is an educational title for children ages three through six, based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. In this game players learn and improve basic skills such as recognizing shapes or opposites, learning the alphabet and counting and grouping items and colors. Each of the simple games is accompanied with cartoon animations and sound effects of Stickybear and his friends. The game is bilingual in English and Spanish.
title: Stickybear: Preschool

description:
Surf City is an interactive musical with songs from the Beach Boys.

In the game the player is presented with an overview map of the beach town aptly named Surf City. The player can click on various streets, which triggers a scene where the street scrolls by and the player can click on the various buildings he wants to visit. Inside the building the player can talk to people and interact with items. The scenes are accompanied with Beach Boys music from the 60s and help tell the story of the main characters of the game.

There's various games and activities to be played as well such as:

  • Build a hot rod
  • Go bowling at the Beach Bowl
  • Design a surfboard
  • Play the video jukebox
  • Race cars at the arcade speedway
  • Take a pizza order
  • Learn surf lingo from Tiki
  • Visit the love teller
  • Take a pop quiz at the high school
  • Watch fireworks on the pier
  • Order a burger-to-go
  • Play spin-the-bottle at Wendy's house
title: Surf City

description:
Go: Special Edition is a digital version of the classic Chinese board game. The game is played with two players or against an AI. Like in the board game players take turns to place white or black markers on intersections of the game grid. The goal is to gain a majority control of the board. Players can remove an opponents markers by completely surrounding them with their own.

The game includes video tutorials from professional Go players and a complete history behind the game Go and a strategy guide.
title: Go: Special Edition

description:
Tom: Magic Picture Show is an educational game for children ages 2 and up. In the game they can learn English, French or German through a variety of activities.

Activities include various puzzle games and a coloring book. The whole game is accompanied with a soundtrack.
title: Tom: Magic Picture Show

description: Archeon CD-i Quiz is a history pop quiz created in cooperation with an archeology themed park of the same name in the Netherlands. The questions are accompanied with images from the park and drawing's of the park's mammoth mascot. All questions are in Dutch.
title: Archeon CD-i Quiz

description:
De Gratis Abonnee CD-i is a free disc that came with a membership of the Dutch magazine CD-interactief.

The disc contains 10 full games:

The Wizard is a Pong variant in which the player has to rescue a fairy from an evil wizard. As a knight the player has to bounce a ball to destroy the prison wall that keeps the fairy from freedom. At the same time he has prevent the wizard from destroying his own wall.

Full Attack is a shoot 'm up in which the player controls a futuristic space ship and has to kill alien monsters. There are four levels with distinct backgrounds (face, junk, ice and crazy). Each level is about three minutes long. The player has three lives and can choose from multiple difficulty levels. Players are awarded with a highscore.

Skid Start is a racing game in which you collect flags, for each flag you gain points. When enough flags are collected an entrance to the next level opens up. There's a time limit within the flags have to be collected. This time limit can be increased by collecting clocks. AI cars are also racing around the circuit and colliding with them causes the player to lose one of initially five cars. Losing the final car ends the game. When after all eight levels are completed the player still has time on the clock he can hunt down the AI cars in order to score bonus points.

Super Slide is a sliding puzzle. It features 21 different pictures. Depending on the number of moves and time you spend on the puzzle you gain a highscore. There are two game modes: "Practice" and "Challenge".

Draw, Stamp & Color is a drawing program with a coloring book, stamping and free drawing. The player can pick from 18 different colors.

Morphon Invasion is a Space Invaders clone. The player controls an elephant who can fire peanuts. Cartoon characters are moving towards the player and have to be hit. This game also features multiple difficulty levels. Different enemies throw different items at the player such as bones, tomatoes or buckets of water.

Where's That Sound is the classical game of Memory but with sounds instead of pictures. The game can be played with up to four players.

Hot Rocks is an Asteroids clone. You shoot asteroids from your spaceship. Only this time you view the action from the cockpit. You can look forward to fire at approaching asteroids or backwards to fire at those you missed and are hurtling towards the earth. A health bar shows how much more hits the player can endure and a 3D radar shows where asteroids are.

In Yoko-San the player has to rescue a Geisha from a dark Ninja. In this action adventure the player can fight and interact with items such as keys. He has to find 7 pieces of a magical mirror to save the Geisha.

Spelling Pirates is a Hangman game. It can be played in English or Dutch. The game features 500 words of a maximum of eight letters. Instead of being hung when the player doesn't guess the word in time, he's fed to the sharks.
title: CD-interactief: De Gratis Abonnee CD-i

description:
Dit Was 1994: Wereldnieuws Overzicht is a compilation disc of news events of 1994 from Dutch public television. It includes 180 news facts from that year. These facts are presented through 40 film fragments, 500 pictures and 100 radio fragments. The content is provided by news agency ANP and public broadcaster NOS.

In addition to all this information there is a pop quiz to test or refresh your knowledge of the year. The quiz features 180 different questions.
title: Dit Was 1994: Wereldnieuws Overzicht

description:
Thumbelina is an interactive telling of the story by Hans Christian Andersen. It features video fragments and stills from the cartoon film by Don Bluth. As the story is told images are show in the background. Many of these images include activities. These activities include coloring, starting animations through clicking on hot-spots and simple puzzles like counting objects and moving shapes to the correct sockets with the cursor.

Colored images start to animate once they are filled in. The whole story is divided into seven chapters, so that it is possible to skip to the activities you want to play, or continue the story at a different time.
title: Thumbelina

description:
Tim & Bear at the Movies is the fourth part in the series. After having flown to their cousin Tina and having visited the harbor, Tim and Bear return with the airplane, but through accident end up in a movie development studio.

The game is an interactive cartoon film in which the viewer watches Tim & Bear explore the movie studio. Viewers can opt to let the cartoon roll, or at times interfere and tell Tim or Bear what to do by choosing from several preset options. This creates tiny differences in how the story progresses.
title: Tim & Bear at the Movies

description:
Tim & Bear at the Harbour is the third part in the series. After having flown to their cousin Tina, Tim and Bear go on a quest to find the screw propeller of uncle Bob's boat. They have to look all over the harbor to find it.

The game is an interactive cartoon film in which the viewer watches Tim & Bear explore the harbor and even underwater. Viewers can opt to let the cartoon roll, or at times interfere and tell Tim or Bear what to do by choosing from several preset options. This creates tiny differences in how the story progresses.
title: Tim & Bear at the Harbour

description:
Clue 2: The Mysteries Continue is a full-motion video adaptation of the popular board game and sequel to the first installment. The game is basically the same as the first, but features three new murder cases that have to be solved. Each case has four different solutions.

In Blackmail Mr. Boddy is murdered by someone he was blackmailing.

In Road to Damascus Boddy almost died in a car accident. After radically changing his lifestyle someone has decided to kill him.

In Not in my Backyard Boddy is being influenced by a mysterious sect. Just when he wants to donate his entire fortune to the sect he is suddenly murdered.

In all the cases the players have to find the murderer, the place of death and the weapon used. Like the previous game there are full-motion videos that progress the story.
title: Clue 2: The Mysteries Continue

description:
Dit Was 1995 is a compilation disc of news events of 1995 from Dutch public television. It includes 200 news facts from that year. These facts are presented through 60 film fragments, 500 pictures and radio fragments. The content is provided by news agency ANP and public broadcaster NOS.

In addition to all this information there is a pop quiz to test or refresh your knowledge of the year.
title: Dit Was 1995

description:
Enkhuizer Almanak 1997 is the 402nd edition of the yearly published Almanac of the Dutch city Enkhuizen.

This 402nd edition of the almanac is filled with useful tips for around the house, on the field or at sea, a complete calendar with tides, the positions of the stars and weather statistics.
