Additionally this digital almanac allows the user to view the first edition of the Enkhuizer Almanak, view a film about the city, and listen to a story about the ship "De Gouden Buys" and play a word game.

The game presents the player with a grid of 64 syllables. The player has to create a single sentence with these syllables. This is done through moving across the grid like the knight in chess. Each grid has only a single solution.
title: Enkhuizer Almanak 1997

description: Paint School II is a title that allows children to paint on their CD-i. There are three different categories available: Count along, letter mountain and shape country. Each category has many different drawings to color, but the player can also opt to create his own drawing from scratch. There's 32,000 colors to pick from. Each drawing can be turned into a sliding puzzle which has to be solved. The whole package is accompanied with an up-beat soundtrack.
title: Paint School II

description:
Santa Claus' Mice is an audio book with activities and games for children of ages 3 to 7. The story is about a mouse who works for Santa Claus. The text can be displayed while it is pronounced for early readers to learn the words.

Aside from the story itself there's also games to be played. Parents can select games of an appropriate age level for their children. There are five games to be played, but they are all pretty much similar. In each game a series of questions is asked. The player can click on a picture which represents a scene, person, animal or item from the game to select his or her answer. Some questions are about the content of the game. Others ask for the opinion of the player (for example: "During which part of the story would you have been most frightened if you were the main character?") There's no wrong answer in these cases.

The game is part of the Storybook Adventures series and features the exact same interface as the other titles in the series: a magic bookmark that turns into a wizard as your guide.

sample_screenshots.caption: The bookmark that's also a wizard.

title: Santa Claus' Mice

description: Le journal interactif 95 is a collection of newsreels from the French broadcast company TF1. In this multimedia title you can review all the news subjects of 1995. A quiz lets the player test his knowledge of the events of this year. It is the sequel to Le journal interactif 94 from the year before with of course all new news facts.
title: Le journal interactif 95

description:
Moses: Bound for the Promised Land is a an educational title for children in which they learn about this classic story from the old Testament. Aside from the actual story of Moses leaving Egypt for Israel, it comes with some games, more information about the time frame in which the story takes place, scripture from the Bible and a play room.

The play room features sing along songs, connect the dots, a sliding puzzle and a coloring book.
title: Moses: Bound for the Promised Land

description:
Tetris for the CD-i is a conversion of the classic puzzle game. Geometric shapes fall from the top of a playfield to rest on the bottom; fit the pieces together, and the line they form disappears. If the pieces don't form lines and eventually stack up to the top of the playfield, the game is over. Difficulty increases by dropping the pieces faster and faster over time.

This CD-i version of the game features slightly different graphics, video nature scenes at the background while you play and a relaxing soundtrack by Jim Andron. The game play stays exactly identical to the classic.
title: Tetris

description:
NFL: The Ultimate Football Collection - Triple Pack is a compilation of two NFL football games and one video for the CD-i. It includes:

  • NFL Hall of Fame Football
  • NFL Football Trivia Challenge: '94-'95 Edition
  • NFL 100 Greatest Touchdowns - a 1993 video by NFL Films and narrated by Steve Sabol that features the 100 greatest touchdowns scored since 1936 as voted on by American sportswriters
title: NFL: The Ultimate American Football Collection - Triple Pack

alternate_titles.title: La Macchina Delle Favole: Racconti di Magia
La Maquina de Cuentos: Cuentos Magicos

description:
Story Machine: Magic Tales is an updated version of Spinnaker's 1980s home computer games Story Machine and Kidwriter. Like the original, this is a storytelling game that aims to teach young players about language. Children can create stories of up to 20 pages, each of which can feature text and animated characters/props ("actors"). Compared to the original version, this CD-i update features much more advanced artwork, the ability to add music to scenes, and the ability to create longer stories. In addition to being able to save competed stories to the CD-i's internal memory, it also has instructions for players on how to record their creations to VHS.

The CD-i Story Machine was released in two volumes which feature similar gameplay but different themes. Magic Tales focuses on fantasy stories.
title: Story Machine: Magic Tales

alternate_titles.title: La Macchina Delle Favole: Racconti Spaziali
La Maquina de Cuentos: Sueños de Estrellas

description:
Story Machine: Star Dreams is an updated version of Spinnaker's 1980s home computer games Story Machine and Kidwriter. Like the original, this is a storytelling game that aims to teach young players about language. Children can create stories of up to 20 pages, each of which can feature text and animated characters/props ("actors"). Compared to the original version, this CD-i update features much more advanced artwork, the ability to add music to scenes, and the ability to create longer stories. In addition to being able to save competed stories to the CD-i's internal memory, it also has instructions for players on how to record their creations to VHS.

The CD-i Story Machine was released in two volumes which feature similar gameplay but different themes. Star Dreams focuses on science fiction stories.
title: Story Machine: Star Dreams

description:
This short game was exhibited at the International Garden and Greenery Exposition (Expo '90) held in Osaka, Japan, in 1990. It provides a brief engaging multimedia experience on the theme of botany.

In the distant future, the planet Third has been rendered uninhabitable by an enormous meteor shower that ruined the atmosphere and rendered the air unbreathable. The space ship Beagle, named after the ship which carried Darwin on his famous naturalist exhibition, is exploring the galaxy to catalogue unique species. They discover a flower that, if brought back to Third, could remove the excess carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and render it livable again. On their way back, however, ship captains Takeru and Ursula become trapped in a meteor shower that threatens to destroy their precious cargo - and them along with it. Players must defend them in a Missile Command-style minigame by shooting down every meteor before it reaches them.

Players have the option of either watching the 3-minute opening cutscene, and then playing the minigame, or skipping straight to the minigame. Players can select one of three different difficulty levels, which affects meteor patterns and movement speed. In the minigame, the Beagle is in the centre of a radar and meteors approach from all sides. Players control a crosshair using a trackball controller, and clicking button 1 fires a bomb which takes out any nearby meteors. The Beagle has two shields, so it's able to survive up to two hits without being destroyed. A round lasts 50 seconds, at the end of which the player is given a message depending on how many shields they had remaining.

sample_screenshots.caption: The discovery of this flower could save Third and restore its environment.
Gameplay. The Beagle is in the centre; the yellow dots are meteors.
Takeru and Ursula discussing their plans to return home.

title: The Adventure of the Space Ship Beagle

description: Mah-jong is a straightforward simulation of Japanese mahjong. In addition to a standard four-player mahjong game with the AI, it features a mahjong tutorial and a quiz mode which tests the player's familiarity with scoring rules. It's licensed from the Japan Professional Mahjong League and features the digitized likenesses of eight real-life professional players.
title: Mah-jong

description: Horoscope is a Japanese fortune-telling game similar to Taboo: The Sixth Sense. It allows the player to have their fortune told using a few different traditional Japanese fortune-telling techniques. These fortunes were overseen by real-life fortune-teller Ryuji Kagami. It allows players to register their identity via entering birthdate, gender, and birthplace, and can use the CD-i's clock to provide up-to-date fortunes.
title: Horoscope: Seiyō Senseijutsu

description: Golgo 13 is an adventure game based on the manga of the same name. It follows the adventures of Duke Togo, the world's greatest assassin, as he sets out on various missions. It includes thirteen different plots adapted from stories in the original manga; these are presented in the form of black and white manga panels with voice acting. At key points in the story, the player interacts by choosing from one of several choices. It also includes a "database" mode, in which the player is quizzed on details of Duke Togo's adventures spanning the last few decades.
title: Golgo 13
